title: Peter Bagge - The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories from Hate
description:
Digital Digital Digital Digital Digital Digital

-------------------------------------------------

The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories From Hate
Vol. One: Hey, Buddy!
Fantagraphics, 1993 (this book is the third printing, 1998), 124 pages, b&w
Written and Illustrated by Peter Bagge
Collects material originally appearing in Hate issues 1-5 

The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories From Hate
Vol. Two: Buddy The Dreamer
Fantagraphics, 1994, 124 pages, b&w
Written and Illustrated by Peter Bagge
Collects material originally appearing in Hate issues 6-10

The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories From Hate
Vol. Three: Fun With Buddy and Lisa
Fantagraphics, 1995, 124 pages, b&w
Written and Illustrated by Peter Bagge
Collects material originally appearing in Hate issues 11-15 


--------------------------------------------------------

The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories From Hate
Vol. Four: Buddy Go Home!
Fantagraphics, 1997, 132 pages, color
Written and Illustrated by Peter Bagge
Collects material originally appearing in Hate issues 16-20 

The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories From Hate
Vol. Five: Buddy's Got Three Moms!
Fantagraphics, 1999, 132 pages, color
Written and Illustrated by Peter Bagge
Collects material originally appearing in Hate issues 21-25 

The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories From Hate
Vol. Six: Buddy Bites The Bullet
Fantagraphics, 2001, 132 pages, color
Collects material originally appearing in Hate issues 22 & 26-30

--------------------------------------------------------

This latest edition collects all of the black and white issues, 1-15, into a single volume.

Buddy Does Seattle: The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories from "Hate" Comics Vol. 1 (1990-'94) 

Fantagraphics, 2005, 340 pages

Written and Illustrated by Peter Bagge

These legendary stories, from the classic first fifteen issues of Bagge's Hate comic, are a defining icon of Seattle's early 1990s culture (the Seattle Weekly has written, "20 years from now, when people wonder what it was like to be young in 1990s Seattle, the only record we'll have is Hate."), as well as Generation X in general (as seen in such films as Kids and Pecker). This is the first time these hilarious stories, starring the hapless Buddy Bradley and his cast of loser cohorts, have ever been available under one cover, and never have they been available at such a low price (it would have cost at least three times as much to read all of these classic stories in any previous editions). Bagge's riotous tales of the early 1990s subculture are more hilarious now than ever, find out why he has been praised by R. Crumb, Matt Groening, John Kricfalusi, Publishers Weekly, Entertainment Weekly and many more. Comedy genius.

--------------------------------------------------------

There is also a collected color volume, Buddy Does Jersey: The Complete Buddy Bradley Stories from "Hate" Comics Vol. 2 (1994-'98), but I don't have that one
